alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 5:50PM EDT until August 20 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of West Central Ohio, including the following counties, Auglaize, Logan and Shelby. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 548 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Although the heaviest rain has ended, lingering high water from earlier storms may cause flooding to continue in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Newport, Anna, Fort Loramie, Jackson Center, Russells Point, Botkins, Lakeview, Chippewa Park, Kettlersville, Montra, Swanders, Mccartyville, New Hampshire, Lake Loramie State Park and Houston.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
